active_learning.discussion_prompt: Analyze why HTML context encoding must be context-specific. Using OWASP XSS Prevention Cheat Sheet guidelines, debate scenarios where using the wrong encoding type (e.g., HTML body encoding in an attribute) leads to XSS. Provide vulnerable and fixed code examples in PHP or JS.
active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, one student explains encoding rules for a specific HTML context (e.g., attributes vs. JS), while the other uses teach-back by fixing a provided vulnerable snippet. Switch roles and contexts (text, URL, CSS).
active_learning.problem_solving: Debug 3 real-world code snippets vulnerable to XSS (e.g., user comments in HTML body/attributes). Apply context-aware encoding, test with payloads like '<script>alert(1)</script>', and verify fixes using browser dev tools.
